I came here for their paella and I was impressed!   The ambience was old-school and traditional but very charming.  They have several big dining areas so coming here for lunch had no wait!  We had the house white wine and it was refreshing and crisp.  The steamed mussels mariner style were extremely fresh and each mussel was just cooked right and humongous.  The fish-only paella was heavenly with every grain of rice standing on its own and not mushy at all.  The sauce was not too rich or salty.  The seafood are all very fresh and plentiful.   It indeed lived up to its reputation of having one of the best paella in Barcelona.
